page.title: 12Natural History In Wootton
page.content: Dr. Campbell is an ornitholigist,who lives in Wootton.He has been interested in birds since the age of 2.The bird he has studied most is the spotted flycatcher.He studied it in the Forest of Dean.He has written about 6 books, his longest one had about 1 million words in it.It took him over 6 years to write.The most rare bird he has seen in Wootton were some cranes.His favourite two birds are the ringed plover and the common sand pipe.Dr campbell has seen about 260 speices of birds. At school we do a nature diary for a year.At the end of the school year Dr Campbell comes into school and judges them.If they are good enough he gives you a book about different aspects to do with wildlife.
